articles.title: American couple separated by coronavirus quarantine
articles.description: An American couple who traveled in the Diamond Princess cruise ship that's docked at the Daikoku Pier Cruise Terminal in Yokohama, Japan, have had their hopes of coming home dashed. Rebecca Frasure has tested positive for the coronavirus, which means she has …

articles.author: Mick Krever, Sandi Sidhu and Veronica Stracqualursi, CNN
articles.title: US to evacuate Americans on cruise ship quarantined in Japan from coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: The US government is preparing to evacuate Americans who have been quarantined on a cruise ship in Japan for over a week, after dozens of people on board tested positive for the novel coronavirus earlier this month.
articles.content:
(CNN)The US government is preparing to evacuate Americans who have been quarantined on a cruise ship in Japan for over a week, after dozens of people on board tested positive for the novel coronavirus earlier this month.

articles.author: Radina Gigova, CNN
articles.title: Amid looming coronavirus crisis, progress made in fight against Ebola
articles.description: As China and the world try to stop the spread of the novel coronavirus, the fight against another deadly disease, Ebola, has reached an encouraging "milestone," the World Health Organization said Friday.
articles.content:
(CNN)As China and the world try to stop the spread of the novel coronavirus, the fight against another deadly disease, Ebola, has reached an encouraging "milestone," the World Health Organization said Friday.

articles.title: Asian man alleges discrimination at multiple hotels amid coronavirus fears
articles.description: Kao Lor was traveling through Plymouth, Indiana, to buy a car and needed somewhere to stay, but he alleges he was subjected to racist questioning amid the coronavirus outbreak. CNN affiliate WBND reports.

articles.author: Hanna Ziady, CNN Business
articles.title: These bonds were supposed to help fight diseases like coronavirus. They've never paid out
articles.description: Three years ago, the World Bank issued new bonds to raise funds that could be used to help poor countries fight pandemics. The money is still sitting on the sidelines.

articles.title: US moves to evacuate passengers from cruise ship
articles.description: Beijing has ordered a mandatory 14-day quarantine for travelers returning to the city, with novel coronavirus cases continuing to rise in China and international experts warning there's no immediate end in sight.

articles.author: Jessie Yeung, CNN
articles.title: Coronavirus triggers biggest work-from-home experiment
articles.description: In offices across Asia, desks are empty, as the region grapples with the deadly coronavirus. Instead, millions are participating in what may be the world's biggest work-from-home experiment.
articles.content:
Hong Kong (CNN)In offices across Asia, desks are empty and the phones are quiet, as the region grapples with a deadly virus.
In major hubs like Hong Kong and Singapore, shops are shuttered, public facilities are closed, and there are few people wandering the… [+8444 chars]

articles.author: Analysis by James Griffiths, CNN
articles.title: WHO's relationship with China under scrutiny due to coronavirus crisis
articles.description: Sitting alongside Chinese President Xi Jinping in Beijing's Great Hall of the People, World Health Organization director general Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus was effusive in his praise of the country's response to the coronavirus crisis.
articles.content:
.@WHO, what's wrong with you? First you called us "Taiwan, China," then you changed to "Taipei." You misreported the confirmed cases, & now you call us "Taipei & Environs." Look! Taiwan is #Taiwan & not any part of the #PRC. JW
— Ministry of Fore… [+56 chars]

articles.author: Shawn Nottingham and Dave Alsup, CNN
articles.title: Hmong men records alleged coronavirus discrimination at Indiana hotels
articles.description: Two Hmong men say they have been discriminated against out of fear of the novel coronavirus while looking for a hotel room in Indiana.

articles.author: By Jessie Yeung and Steve George, CNN
articles.title: Coronavirus cases rise to more than 67,000 globally
articles.description: The novel coronavirus has killed more than 1,500 people and infected more than 67,000 people globally. Follow here for the latest
articles.content: The number of deaths from the novel coronavirus, known as Covid-19, has now risen to more than 1,500 worldwide. All but three of those deaths took place in China. And thousands of new cases of the virus have been confirmed in China, under the country's new br… [+1330 chars]
